user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SocketListen_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_SocketListen_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token)
{
    int                             os_result;
    OS_impl_file_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_filehandle_table, *token);

    os_result = listen(impl->fd, 10);
    if (os_result < 0)
    {
        OS_DEBUG("listen: %s\n", strerror(errno));
        return OS_ERROR;
    }

    return OS_SUCCESS;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function OS_SocketListen_Impl:
typedef struct
{
    int  fd;
    bool selectable;
} OS_impl_file_internal_record_t
...
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
extern OS_impl_file_internal_record_t OS_impl_filehandle_table[OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES]
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Fragments NOT listed do not need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13: the function parameter is already a pointer to a const-qualified type (const OS_object_token_t *token), the listen call uses an integer file descriptor (impl->fd) not a pointer type, and the function return type and local scalar variables do not involve pointer-to-object types. The extern array declaration (OS_impl_filehandle_table) is a non-const object; while it is related to pointer usage, the actual pointer variables/usages that could drop const-qualification are covered in the reported fragments above. No other pointer declarations or expressions are present in the provided code that would be candidates for adding const qualification under Rule 8.13.
